p: At each site we established 20–26 0.5 m 2 (1 m × 0.5 m) permanent quadrats (marking corners with PVC stakes) along two to four randomly established transects. We placed the first quadrat at random in an existing A. petiolata patch and spaced additional quadrats at 10 m intervals. We shifted quadrat locations as necessary to ensure that A. petiolata rosettes or adults were present in every quadrat, except for two sites in Michigan where some quadrats did not contain A. petiolata at the start of the monitoring period.
